intro: Artanthe rudgeana, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant red or purple flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Artanthe rudgeana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
